articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The world's chemical weapons watchdog on Friday said it had once again found traces of tear gas on the frontline with Russia in Ukraine's central-east Dnipropetrovsk region.
articles.title: New traces of tear gas found on Ukraine battlefield by chemical weapons watchdog

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Gram Slattery, Nandita Bose
articles.description: As tech billionaire Elon Musk expands his influence over more than a dozen U.S. federal agencies, frustration is growing among some top aides to President Donald Trump, who want more coordination from Musk's team as he slashes the U.S. government, according to four people aware of the tensions.
articles.title: Insight: Elon Musk’s tactics frustrate some senior White House officials

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Tom Hals
articles.description: Two federal judges will consider on Friday whether Elon Musk's government cost-cutting team known as DOGE will have access to Treasury Department payment systems and potentially sensitive data at U.S. health, consumer protection and labor agencies.
articles.title: Musk's DOGE team: Judges to consider barring it from US government systems

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant groups in Gaza said they would release hostages Iair Horn, U.S.-Israeli Sagui Dekel-Chen and Russian-Israeli Alexandre Sasha Troufanov on Saturday, in accordance with the terms of the ceasefire with Israel.
articles.title: Gaza militant groups will release three hostages on Saturday, Hamas official says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had offered to talk about easingtariffs, buying more U.S. oil, gas and combat aircraft, concessions that may deter a trade war.
articles.title: India's Modi and Trump agree to trade talks to lower tensions

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, David Lawder, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he plans to unveil reciprocal tariffs on Thursday afternoon but gave no details about his latest tariff plan, which could take aim at every country that charges duties on U.S. imports.
articles.title: Trump says reciprocal tariffs coming on Thursday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis was taken to hospital on Friday morning for tests and to continue treatment of his ongoing bronchitis, the Vatican said.
articles.title: Pope Francis taken to hospital for bronchitis treatment

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: More than 500 million people have taken a "holy dip" in sacred river waters in north India over the last four weeks as part of the Hindu Maha Kumbh festival, authorities said on Friday, greater than the population of most countries.
articles.title: More than 500 million take 'holy dip' in India's Maha Kumbh festival

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A ceasefire has enabled some Gazans to go back to their ruined homes without fear of Israeli airstrikes, but they have returned to a severe water crisis.
articles.title: Gazans return to ruined homes and severe water shortage

articles.author: Maggie Michael, Nafisa Eltahir, Khalid Abdelaziz
articles.description: Sudan's Rapid Support Forces have attacked the famine-stricken Zamzam displacement camp, residents and medics say, as the paramilitary tries to tighten its grip on its Darfur stronghold while losing ground to the army in the capital, Khartoum.
articles.title: Sudan's RSF attacks famine-stricken camp as battle lines harden
